website_summaries.verdict: The Linksys EA6100 is an affordable dual-band router that delivers good 2.4GHz throughput, but 5GHz performance comes up short, and its features are underwhelming.

customer_reviews.title: Good Router with Local USB Access
customer_reviews.text: It does the job and easy to set up and configure. What I really like about it is that it is small, modern looking and functional with network access to the inserted USB stick via smb:// on your PC/iMAC. Only the v3 has the USB 2.0 Port - so be careful. No need to Flash it with AdvancedTomato as it works with NordVPN directly, unless you want to use OpenVPN instead of L2TP. On the downside the Linksys Router Settings Dashboard is nasty, clunky and extremely basic.
customer_reviews.author: Liam

customer_reviews.title: Recommended replacement for the basic router your broadband provider may have supplied.
customer_reviews.text: Works so much better than the bodged router that PlusNet supplied as standard. That couldn't cope with delivering smart tv content wirelessly across the house but this does the job no bother. Dual bands means less change of interference with neighbours, and guest login makes it easy to keep your network secure without having to disclose your main password.
customer_reviews.author: Andy G

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few routers over the years and the Linksys EA6350 stands out. The Android app is really useful and allows you turn wifi access on/off for all connected devices - especially useful when teenagers spend too long on their phones/tablets.
customer_reviews.author: Avid

customer_reviews.title: Fiddly to set up, but likely my fault.
customer_reviews.text: I had an earlier version of this, regretfully it failed earlier in the year after 5 years. However I liked the device so bought another. Setup? Fine really, maybe not best i installed Mojave on my Mac yesterday so ended up using my Win laptop. Appears to working well, wish one could turn off the Linksys LED on the top? (Edit 06.10.18 been work fine)
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Parental control app is great
customer_reviews.text: Superb. After some research and indecision I plumped for this router as opposed to the Netgear equivalent to control the flow of internet to my children, hoping that the Linksys app would be easy for me to use as a not-very-tech-savvy parent. The set up and ongoing use of the router and associated app are both terrific, and we are a much happier, more organised, communicative, friendly household because of it. 125 of the best Earth pounds I have spent for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Sessarego Mercer

customer_reviews.title: Pain to set up.
customer_reviews.text: This was a pain to setup. It would not remember my password. Some of the screens you end up going around in circles from one screen to another and then back again. Took over 30 minutes to setup. I have set up other routers before, this was the most complicated.
customer_reviews.author: Manfred Mann

customer_reviews.title: Poor range
customer_reviews.text: Not very impressed. I purchased this for two reasons, one was to use the Internet logs, that were not available on my existing router modem & the other was to improve the range. The logs have no time stamp, so not much use, and the range is worse than my Virgin Super Hub!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Saundg

customer_reviews.title: Setup easy, reach poor
customer_reviews.text: Worse than broadband suppliers router... My main objective was to extend the reach of the suppliers' N router with this AC one. Overall it was much worse. Setup was easy but reach poor
customer_reviews.author: Christian D.

customer_reviews.title: The Linksys EA6350 is a fine purchase and has provided me with a stable and ...
customer_reviews.text: Having a duel band router is certainly a plus as my previous Plusnet router was single band, my laptops kept losing the wifi signal and as plusnet were not interested in solving the problem I was forced to buy a new router. The Linksys EA6350 is a fine purchase and has provided me with a stable and consistent wifi signal. One minor criticism is that the signal strength is no better than my plusnet router, and as Linksys claim that the router has "Ultimate range" (whatever that means) it's a little dissappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Clive Deer

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: Excellent device,just one advice ! Do use it with the original adapter,do not use your old one unless it is the same brand. Otherwise will cause drop downs of connectivity! Other than that it is great product with excellent online support and very helpful agents!
customer_reviews.author: Rosen Stoev-TOTTI

customer_reviews.title: Does the job I wanted it for.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to set up as an access point so I could use the parental controls, after some initial problems with set-up got it up and running and it works perfectly. Had hunted for a long time for something that had basic easy to use parental control and this is the answer. Log in, choose the device and set the times it can access the internet and away you go. I wish they were all as easy as this. Son not happy though!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Superquick router and easily upgradeable to an opensource firmware.
customer_reviews.text: This linksys e2500 is a great router - its lightning quick and handles multiple connections. The range of the WIFI is also impressive. I have upgraded mine to an open source firmware (Tomato) as this allows me to use the unit with special VPN connections that are secure. I really like this model and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: MR PWalker

customer_reviews.title: Great gigabit router with amazing price tag :)
customer_reviews.text: Everything that I needed in a router with a great price! Internet and LAN speeds are great, management and installation too. Some say it lacks some features, but I didn't notice anything missing. I'm using smart TV with Netflix, Xiaomi TV box, smart receiver, XBOX, laptops and smartphones and everything works great. Range is fair too. It replaced a simple 300N router and is way much better...
customer_reviews.author: Supers

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace TP-Link router in effort to improve wifi signal to smart tv but wifi spped was actually slower with this router and setup/menus dire
customer_reviews.author: Wallace M.

customer_reviews.title: Very Good WiFi Router
customer_reviews.text: My old Linksys router gave up the ghost recently after 6 years with no problems so after a brief search I went for this. Set up is a doddle on Windows 7 and the router is very good. A lot quicker than the old one and the range is very good throughout the house and even works in the garden (about 25M & through several walls). The set up menu is easy to navigate with plenty of options. Good router. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: MattyD1

customer_reviews.title: A gem - compared to some others multi band multi ...
customer_reviews.text: A gem - compared to some others multi band multi user and manageable Can also act as a wireless music server or video server using common protocols using a usb hard drive. Web interface VPNS, VLANS gigabyte wired interface
customer_reviews.author: Finlay Blackwood

customer_reviews.title: Great Router for the price
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on day promised. Used as second router for VPN. I was unable to connect wifi extenders to it using WPS otherwise would give it 5 stars. Have not noted any change in speed.
customer_reviews.author: Abdul Mohidin

customer_reviews.title: Not great but ok.
customer_reviews.text: Has a cut off of 100Mb/s, despite being faster. Go figure.
customer_reviews.author: Ashrob

customer_reviews.title: good and bad
customer_reviews.text: It was brilliant once I got it to work as I am using it as a seccondary router which meant I couldn't use the disk to set if up!! To be noted the support is hit and miss its fine once you get through to someone but you can be sat on hold for agers and sometimes they will just cut you off.
customer_reviews.author: A Mother F**** Ninja

customer_reviews.title: No problems after quite a long time of use, ...
customer_reviews.text: No problems after quite a long time of use, works well even when left on 24/7. Slightly lower range than my previous router but hasn't affected my use of the device.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McCallum

customer_reviews.title: Not as Advertised No Firewall
customer_reviews.text: Advertised as including a firewall but lacks fundamental Firewall functionality of Blocking a Port.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Had issues with this very poor download speed manufacturer could not resolve the issue
customer_reviews.author: Gadgetforme

customer_reviews.title: very good
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for reliable router that would meet my expectations. This is great product. Even though people often report problems with signal coverage I did not experience it. Using it in 5 bedroom house and we have good coverage even in the garden. Highly recommending.
customer_reviews.author: Zuzana K.

customer_reviews.title: Replacement router
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my old Netgear router as I needed something faster and more up to date for streaming music and movies, this works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mr J Walker

customer_reviews.title: connection no connection
customer_reviews.text: Very poor wireless always disconnecting i will be sending it back
customer_reviews.author: Dont be nosy

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement router
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement fro a BT Broadband Hub with which we had been having continuing signal problems which they said would be sorted by using one of their upgraded routers (at a price and another contract). This was easy to set up and so far we have had no signal drop out, despite multiple devices being connected, it works really well.
customer_reviews.author: RL

customer_reviews.title: Spend a bit extra and get one that works properly
customer_reviews.text: Looks good but very poor signal coverage and very intermittent in connecting devices. Good for a budget but if you’re looking for something that works well, buy cheap buy twice!....
customer_reviews.author: Adam Dunley

customer_reviews.title: No issues
customer_reviews.text: We use this to broadcast via our remote server. It works and 10 people can connect at the same time without any stalling or buffering issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: with a lot of good features. Has been in use for several months ...
customer_reviews.text: Works really well, with a lot of good features. Has been in use for several months now all day every day, no problems yet.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Rubbish
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. App doesn't correctly list the device connected. Network runs slow. I've demoted and now it's just a plain functionless access point
customer_reviews.author: R.W.

customer_reviews.title: great value at price  40 pounds  ithink i got it for
customer_reviews.text: great router, dissapointed cannot do a dd-wrt without risk of totally bricking the router . 5ghz wifi though and 2.4 ghz range and speed not that impressed with
customer_reviews.author: fierce craic

customer_reviews.title: The price is a con
customer_reviews.text: Did not provide much increased power/range compared to my previous vodafone router. Also it does not come with a built in modem and nowhere did it say I had to buy a separate standalone modem as well. Until my new modem arrives, I have to plug this kit into my old router in order to get the modem connection. What a con.
customer_reviews.author: Nick H

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Does not handle PPPoA only PPPoE - no good for UK broadband.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Woolley

customer_reviews.title: Quality Router
customer_reviews.text: As I expected does exactly what it is supposed to. Quality router with all the features I needed, haven't tried the USB port yet. Recommended if you need a router with good quality WiFi signal and easy setup.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Happy

customer_reviews.title: Hot, but not in a good way....
customer_reviews.text: Returned. Was running extremely hot. Insides smelt like they were being singed. Exchanged for more robust (and far more expensive model)
customer_reviews.author: Gh0stman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for VPN
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my VPN needs. Flashed it with Tomato, works a treat, wi-fi reaches all 3 floors.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It was nicely packed with no damage to the package or the item and works perfectly thank you.
customer_reviews.author: BenManiac13

customer_reviews.title: Good router for the price
customer_reviews.text: A dual band router which gets the job done well. Signal strength is normal and acceptable for a two story house. 5GHz wifi gets less interference with neighbors' signal.
customer_reviews.author: Buddy

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Support from Belken very poor. Would not purchase a similar product with this standard of support
customer_reviews.author: drumlemen

customer_reviews.title: Works a treat.
customer_reviews.text: Reloaded with DD-WRT (DD-WRT v24-sp2 (03/25/13) big), works a treat. Much better than the hub supplied by my ISP.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad router, but I bought it to be better ...
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad router, but I bought it to be better than BT Homehub, to get better signal in the house, and BT homehub is in fact, better.
customer_reviews.author: H5050

customer_reviews.title: If you're looking for just an access point, look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Useless as an access point. Could not configure correctly - kept hanging, forcing me to reset it several times. Returned it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: William Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and excellent signal around the house
customer_reviews.author: A J Moon

customer_reviews.title: Agree with reviewer from 23 Mar. 2016
customer_reviews.text: Especially the range nowhere close to advertised. Rather disappointing and far behind my old Virgin router. Also mine got very hot on the bottom and the supplied RJ45 cable showed some defects when tested.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Top quality unit that you can actually control.
customer_reviews.text: Flash the firmware for proper access and control. This unit has been around the world with me and has never let me down.
customer_reviews.author: Rev. Mac

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good router. It doesn't have a way to put it on a wall.
customer_reviews.author: Ilan

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. I use it as a range extender from my BT Home Hub 4. Works well.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Cuts out a lot, range is bad and Chromecast fails all the time
customer_reviews.author: JoeRadd

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great piece of kit with strong signal but unfortunately had to return as incompatable with my current set up.
customer_reviews.author: FitzGB

customer_reviews.title: ... router to enhance the wireless signal and it works great. Easy to set-up just plug it straight into ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this with my ADSL sky router to enhance the wireless signal and it works great. Easy to set-up just plug it straight into the back of the sky router with ethernet and done.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Kurt M. Rutherford

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bargain
customer_reviews.text: For 30 pounds, a fast and reliable router. For this price, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: ORDER

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: sorted all my connection problems out and so easy to install
customer_reviews.author: mr g walker

customer_reviews.title: Very slow speeds.
customer_reviews.text: Speed is so slow. On my 200mbps connection, I was lucky to get 10. Really not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Ponkabalon

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Flashed with Advanced Tomato works just fine, wifi range is decent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good price, very easy to set up and works really well. I'd recommend tis to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Great Linksys 2500 router
customer_reviews.text: This Linksys E2500 router is exactly what I needed. It was affordable and compatible with the freely available Linux based dd-wrt firmware. My dd-wrt firmware upgrade has now made this bog standard product by Linksys become enterprise class with so many additional features. It a great product if you know how to use it!
customer_reviews.author: awenger444

customer_reviews.title: It is a Router as expected!
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to install and its application sets in minutes. It has a wide diameter of receiving the WIFI signal but sometimes fails when there are walls in the house! But afterall its a good router for the beginner!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Tanti

customer_reviews.title: Works with DD-WRT
customer_reviews.text: Using as a VPN router using DD-WRT tomato firmware, found it pretty easy to flash, and now it has many great features it would'nt of had without, The version I got from amazon was V3 but did eventually find that you can now flash the v3 version as well I have found the wireless not quite as strong as my apple router but I think its pretty much due to having two routers in the same house im sure i could improve this by changing the channel I'm sure theres much better routers out there that can be flashed but for the money I'm happy
customer_reviews.author: JACK

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router for my student accomodation and the streaming purposes which requires dual band high speed (802.11n) wifi. However, the setup was very fast and it is an excellent router that includes all you need (QoS, port forwarding, IPv6!, firewall, ...).
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value and simple to setup
customer_reviews.text: Works almost straight out of the box, with minimum setup required and a simple instruction set. Good range over a large house and a good 'guest' log in. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: veronique Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Good reliable router
customer_reviews.text: I have always been please with Linksys products and this is no exception. It was easy to set up and has worked reliably ever since.
customer_reviews.author: DarkGalaxy

customer_reviews.title: ideal
customer_reviews.text: running my desktop + laptop and our smart tv on this system and being a 72 year old I found it easy to set up and run just by carefully following the instructions . Which is something of an achievement for me!
customer_reviews.author: graham mosley

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy Router with very poor wifi
customer_reviews.text: Even though this router is a Which Best Buy, The wifi would not work correctly even after Tec support help we could not get a reliable wifi service form this router, very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: MR K S BURRELL

customer_reviews.title: Very fast router for a good price
customer_reviews.text: I like the relaibility and the speed between devices, it has 5ghz and 2.4gz bands , a massive range and its for a relatively cheap price , this was the best deal i could find.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as my previous wireless router got bricked. I'm using it as a home network to connect 2 laptops / 2 phones. This is an excellent router. The setup took a few minutes and was up and running fine. The setup automatically created a guest network and since I did not want that, I had to later go and disable that. The firmware upgrade is automatic and gives notification if there is a newer firmware available. The range appears to be good. I've used it at a distance of up to 20 metres with a couple of walls thrown in between and it worked fine. Will definitely recommend this router
customer_reviews.author: paragkan

customer_reviews.title: bordering on useless to me at least
customer_reviews.text: iphone doesn't often / always connect, bordering on useless to me at least.
customer_reviews.author: MR T J B BEAVIS

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality. Installed a week (after much faffing about ...
customer_reviews.text: Terrible quality. Installed a week (after much faffing about having to reset the damn thing out of the box amongst other things), overheats and locks up. Does the same a week later after leaving it off for 24 hours. Stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Graham B.

customer_reviews.title: Useless if you're using a Mac..
customer_reviews.text: If you have a recent Mac, don't bother. It comes with the install CD in the box which is pretty useless as no recent Mac has a CD-Drive. And (if you have a connection to be able to do it), the software does not support Mavericks so will not install, leaving you with a duff router. The product looks quite sleek but does show finger prints easily. There is also no obvious light on the product (apart from the back) so you'll need to take a closer look if you start having WiFi issues. Also note that unlike the picture shown, this product doesn't stand up. It lies flat.
customer_reviews.author: W. Baker

product_meta.title: Linksys EA6100 AC1200 Dual Band Smart Wi-Fi Router with Fast Ethernet
product_meta.description:
Style Name:AC1200 RouterThe AC1200 features dual wireless bands (2.4 GHz and 5 GHz) with data speeds up to N300 Mbps + AC867 Mbps*, great for media-intense applications such as video streaming and online gaming. Four Fast Ethernet ports make it easy to connect devices directly to the router or share data on external storage devices. Plus, use the USB 2.0 port** to transfer files from a storage device or share a printer across your Wi-Fi network.

BOX CONTAINS
1 x Linksys Smart Wi-Fi Router AC1200 w/FE - MEA6100-UK
feature_bullets: Next generation Wireless-AC standard outperforms Wireless-N, with speeds up to 3x faster.
Delivers a stronger connection at a wider range than a single band.
Share files from your devices and external storage across your network via USB.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars185 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
